maml:description.maml:para: Get Access Point stats in 5 minute segments

Get the stats in 5 minute segments for all or just one access points in a given UniFi site For convenience, we return the traffic Megabytes and not in bytes (as the UniFi does it). We also return real timestamps instead of the unix timestaps that the UniFi returns

maml:Description.maml:para: ID of the client-device to be modified
Client MAC address
Startpoint in UniFi Unix timestamp in milliseconds
Endpoint in UniFi Unix timestamp in milliseconds
ID of the client-device to be modified
Client MAC address
Startpoint in UniFi Unix timestamp in milliseconds
Endpoint in UniFi Unix timestamp in milliseconds

maml:alert.maml:para: Defaults to the past 12 hours. Make sure that the retention policy for 5 minutes stats is set to the correct value in the controller settings Ubiquiti announced this with the Controller version 5.5 - It will not work on older versions!

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get the stats in 5 minute segments for all access points in the default site
Get the stats in 5 minute segments for a given (78:8a:20:59:e6:88) access point in the default site
Get the statistics for a given time period.
Get the statistics for the last 60 minutes (was the timestamp while the sample was created)
Get the stats in 5 minute segments for all access points in the site 'contoso', if traffic is generated.
Get the last stats in 5 minute segments for all access points in the site 'contoso'

maml:description.maml:para: Get user/client statistics in 5 minute segments

Get user/client statistics in 5 minute segments for a given client For convenience, we return the TX/RX traffic in bytes (as the UniFi does it) and Megabytes. We return a summed traffic (based on the combined TX and RX traffic) in Megabytes. We also return real timestamps instead of the unix timestaps that the UniFi returns

maml:Description.maml:para: ID of the client-device to be modified
Client MAC address (required)
Startpoint in UniFi Unix timestamp in milliseconds
Endpoint in UniFi Unix timestamp in milliseconds
array containing attributes (strings) to be returned, defaults to rx_bytes and tx_bytes
ID of the client-device to be modified
Client MAC address (required)
Startpoint in UniFi Unix timestamp in milliseconds
Endpoint in UniFi Unix timestamp in milliseconds
array containing attributes (strings) to be returned, defaults to rx_bytes and tx_bytes

maml:alert.maml:para: Defaults to the past 12 hours. Make sure that the retention policy for 5 minutes stats is set to the correct value in the controller settings Ubiquiti announced this with the Controller version 5.8 - It will not work on older versions! Make sure that "Clients Historical Data" (Collect clients' historical data) has been enabled in the UniFi controller in "Settings/Maintenance"
Sample Output: rx_bytes : 18384.0 rx_mb : 0.02 tx_bytes : 30438.559999999998 tx_mb : 0.03 Traffic : 0.05 time : 2/1/2019 1:15:00 AM

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get user/client statistics in 5 minute segments for a given (78:8a:20:59:e6:88) user/client in the default site
Get user/client statistics in 5 minute segments for a given (78:8a:20:59:e6:88) user/client in the default site for a given time period.
Get user/client statistics in 5 minute segments for a given (78:8a:20:59:e6:88) user/client in the default site for the last 60 minutes (was the timestamp while the sample was created)
Get user/client statistics in 5 minute segments for a given (78:8a:20:59:e6:88) user/client in the site 'contoso'

maml:Description.maml:para: UniFi Site as configured. The default is: default
Client MAC address
Minutes (from now) until authorization expires, the default is 60 (1 hour)
Upload speed limit in Kilobit per second (kbit/s)
Download speed limit in Kilobit per second (kbit/s)
Data transfer limit in megabytes (MB), upload and download will be combined. The default is unlimited
MAC address of the Access Point to which client is connected, should result in a much faster authorization

maml:description.maml:para: Creates the UniFi config JSON file
Creates the UniFi config JSON file. If no input is given it creates one with all the defaults.

maml:Description.maml:para: The login of a UniFi User with admin rights
The password for the user given above. It is clear text for now. I know... But the Ubiquiti UniFi Controller seems to understand plain text only.
Valid is http and https. default is https Please note: http is untested and it might not even work!
If you use a self signed certificate and/or a certificate from an untrusted CA, you might want to use true here. Default is FALSE
The Ubiquiti UniFi Controller you want to use. You can use a Fully-Qualified Host Name (FQHN) or an IP address.
The port number that you have configured on your Ubiquiti UniFi Controller. The default is 8443
Where to safe the JSON config. Default is the directory where you call the function. e.g. .\UniFiConfig.json
Replaces the contents of a file, even if the file is read-only. Without this parameter, read-only files are not changed.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
The login of a UniFi User with admin rights
The password for the user given above. It is clear text for now. I know... But the Ubiquiti UniFi Controller seems to understand plain text only.
Valid is http and https. default is https Please note: http is untested and it might not even work!
If you use a self signed certificate and/or a certificate from an untrusted CA, you might want to use true here. Default is FALSE
The Ubiquiti UniFi Controller you want to use. You can use a Fully-Qualified Host Name (FQHN) or an IP address.
The port number that you have configured on your Ubiquiti UniFi Controller. The default is 8443
Where to safe the JSON config. Default is the directory where you call the function. e.g. .\UniFiConfig.json
Replaces the contents of a file, even if the file is read-only. Without this parameter, read-only files are not changed.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

maml:alert.maml:para: Just an helper function to create a JSON config
